items.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudDay 1 Race and Homelessness Vigil: An Update Day 1 of the Race and Homelessness Vigil...
items.content_html:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

Day 1 Race and Homelessness Vigil: An Update

Day 1 of the Race and Homelessness Vigil was filled with speakers, food, and solidarity.

After setting up our tent...s around 4pm unhoused people who were in Civic Center Park or nearby started to gather asking if they could stay the night in one of these tents - looking for a safe place to sleep. We began to match up people in need with a tent to stay for the night. But around 6pm over 30 police rolled up and began to threaten tickets and arrest on anyone staying in the tents. We ask the police where all the unhoused people who were going to be staying in these tents are expected to go and what protection from the cold they are able to have. Police negotiated with us to give every person who is homeless who was going to be staying there a hotel voucher for the night.

40 individuals and couples who are homeless signed up on our list to get a hotel for the night. These 40+ people all would have otherwise been staying on the streets with minimal gear to stay warm (which even that minimal gear is illegal under the camping ban). They all showed up within an hour or less of setting up the tents because they are desperate for a place to stay warm and safe. They all lined up eagerly to get a hotel, even for a night, because they want housing.

Housed community members who were there for the vigil drove all of these unhoused people seeking hotel to the hotels - dealing with lots of run around from hotel to hotel until all got inside.

We committed to do what we could by using the city resources offered us in exchange for taking down our tents to get folks hotels for the night. One night of a warm safe place to stay with a bathroom and shower for about 40 people otherwise living on the streets.

But all these people will be back out on the streets again tonight... yet again told that if they use any form of protection from the elements they are breaking the law and could be arrested.

We will be back again in Civic Center Park in front of City Hall today with food, speakers, and solidarity in our fight to end racism and homelessness in Denver.

onward... stay tuned for more details... and come join us...

items.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Human ServicesIf you have been financially impacted by #COVID19, have a child living with you at home,...
items.content_html:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Human Services

If you have been financially impacted by #COVID19, have a child living with you at home, and make up to $75,000/year, you may qualify for up to $4,000 in emerge...ncy assistance.

This money can be used to pay rent/mortgage, cover home or auto repairs, pay medical or mental health bills, buy food, and more!

To apply, visit https://coloradopeak.secure.force.com and apply for Colorado Works/TANF by clicking “Apply for Benefits”. Questions? Call 720-944-4DHS (4347).

items.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudSweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When will this Move along...
items.content_html:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

Sweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When will this Move along To NOWHERE End…

There are two more sites where people without housing live t...hat are slated to be swept next week. 21st and Market/Blake is currently home to about 60 people without housing - some of whom have been living for months, some who moved there recently from the 22nd st sweep or the 25th st sweep. This site was posted for a sweep the same day as residents from 25th and Arapahoe moved to this site in search of anywhere to be. 25th and Welton is currently home to another 60 or so people without housing. Most of the residents on the right of way strip on 25th have been living there for many months. Others living in the parking lot area have moved there recently after other sweeps.

Residents of these encampments all ask the same question: where are we supposed to go?? The City has done nothing to get these people access to housing. They are not even being offered hotel rooms through the COVID FEMA funding. They are being told to either go to a shelter or go to jail.

Come support residents of these encampments as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords/Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
